Hi,

I\'ve just been introduced to KSP by someone at work. Cue a particularly late night playing with different designs!

I do have one beginners question - I\'m having a lot of issues getting my rocket pointed the way I want it. I did the tutorial, and I understand about pitch/yaw etc. However, I run into problems as soon as my rocket rolls at all, because if it\'s rolled 90 degrees, what was pitch is now yaw, from my viewpoint. Is there a way to fix the camera so that the camera is absolute towards the ship?

Or am I missing something?!

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Look at the navball/artificial horizon, not the moving camera\'s view, when making any kind of maneuvers. You need to learn how to read that thing; it\'s much more useful than looking at your rocket.

so I had a lot of success last night - managed to get into a stable orbit, and even to the Mun (although I crashed on return).
